container.copyComplete: The email has been copied to the clipboard.

mainPage.greetings: Hello, I'm COYO, a FE developer.

overviewPage.overview: After majoring in software and computer science, I worked as a front-end developer for two years at a startup related to security services for shared offices and apartment entrances and exits.

section2.title: I'm trying to go deeper into different areas of development, not just FE.

section3.title: I like to think about the UI from <highlight>the user's perspective and improve it</highlight>.
section3.text1: I've had the experience of not just drawing a given screen during development, but summarizing what I'd like to see improved from the user's perspective, discussing it, and then incorporating it into the actual service.
section3.text2: Personally, I love infinite scrolling when viewing a list of blog posts, but as the number of posts grows, the endless scrolling can become fatiguing. To avoid this, I added pagination to my personal blog instead of infinite scrolling, and I always have a floating table of contents and buttons to jump to the top and bottom of the post.
section3.text3: I created DISBOARD with my teams, an integrated LMS platform with video conferencing, by combining the experience of using Zoom for virtual lectures, BlackBoard for lecture announcements, and a school portal for grading.

section4.title: I'm trying to <highlight>automate</highlight> the pain points during development.
section4.text1: I have experience using git commit templates, commlint, and semantice-release to standardize commit messages and use them to automate SemVer management, changelog creation, and npm deployment.
section4.text2: I solved the NextJs Large Page Data Warning by writing a js script and

react.text1: I have hands-on experience using React from design to deployment to VOC response.
react.text2: Experience with a variety of state management libraries, including Redux, RTK, and Recoil, enables you to use the right state management for your business logic.
react.text3: In addition to React, I have experience with a variety of frameworks, including NextJS and Gatsby.

javaScript.text2: I have experience working with JS in a node.js environment to accomplish a variety of tasks.

typeScript.text1: I have experience working on various projects using TypeScript and deploying them to real-world services.
typeScript.text2: I have experience leading migrations from JavaScript to TypeScript.

css.text1:
I have experience with both css in js and css preprocessors, but my personal favorite is <scss>SCSS</scss>,
which is a css preprocessor.
css.text2: I can use <scss>SCSS</scss>'s @mixins, functions, conditions, and other features to work with styles productively.
css.text3: I can use <emotion>emotion</emotion>'s CSS Props and StyleComponents in a variety of syntaxes.
css.text4: In practice, I've mostly used <scss>SCSS</scss>, <styledComponent>styled-components</styledComponent>, and <less>less</less>.
css.text5: I've used <emotion>emotion</emotion> and <tailwind>tailwind</tailwind> in various personal projects, including blogs.

activity1.name: Naver Boost Camp
activity1.description: Web development training programs hosted by NAVER Connect

blog.summary: This is a personal blog where I share my personal studies and research.
blog.detail1:
This blog has received about <highlight>5K views</highlight> from January through September 2024, and I measure those views using <highlight>GA4</highlight>.
<post>The related post</post> is on the blog and is the second most viewed post.
blog.detail2: This blog is an SSG site built with NextJS + Tailwind.
blog.detail3: Due to the need to manage commit messages, I used husky + commlint + semantic-release to manage commit messages and also set up SemVer to <highlight>automatically update based on the message</highlight>.  Also made it into a series, and the posts in <series>that series</series> are all getting a lot of views.
blog.detail4: I migrated to <highlight>nextjs</highlight> to improve build times.
blog.detail5: Version 1 is being developed with Gatsby and is being archived separately in a <branch>branch</branch>.
blog.detail6: I tried to make it more convenient and fun for users by using various animations such as marquee animation for tag, carousel for recent post, horizontal scroll and flipped card.

coyoui.summary: This is a UI Kit where I've created UI components that I think I'll use often during a project. I'm adding animations that I use frequently in my blog or other projects.
coyoui.detail1: This is a UI Kit that utilizes <highlight>Storybook</highlight> to create tests. The test site was deployed using <highlight>Chromatic</highlight>.
coyoui.detail2: I used husky + commlint + semantic-release to <highlight>automatically manage SemVer as well as change-logs and release notes via commit messages</highlight>.
coyoui.detail3: You can test out the Marquee animation that was used to create my current blog homepage.

kanbanBoard.summary: A Kanban board site cloned from Notion Board using React-beautiful-dnd.
kanbanBoard.detail1:
I implemented a drag and drop Kanban Board using react-beautiful-dnd.
I developed it so that you can move cards between or across boards, move cards to other boards, and delete boards or cards via Drag and Drop.
I used <highlight>react-hook-form</highlight> to make it easier and more effective to manage inputs. I also stored the boards and cards created by the user, as well as the colors they specified, in localStorage to ensure that the data is retained.
kanbanBoard.detail2: Implemented <highlight>Theme Switching</highlight> using styled-components and useContext.
kanbanBoard.detail3: I used Recoil and React-Color to implement a managed implementation of board colors.

disboard.role: 5-person development (1 AI, 1 BE, 2 FE, 1 MOBILE, myself in FE)
disboard.summary: LMS services to help you make sense of the increase in remote teaching in the aftermath of COVID-19.
disboard.detail1: This was my first project in React, and I developed all of the non-course features.
disboard.detail2: I tried to utilize <highlight>Chartjs</highlight> to make it easier for students and instructors to provide comprehension charts and attendance charts.
disboard.detail3: The service provides items like announcements, lecture notes, and assignments like Blackboard.
disboard.detail4:
The member authentication service is configured with <highlight>Google OAuth 2.0</highlight> to take basic member information and require additional information to use the service.
<highlight>This service is currently registered as a Korean software work, which you can search for on the Korean Copyright Commission.</highlight>
